717538f-a.text:
Broadway, north from but not including West 48th Street, showing sewer construction work in progress extending to West 49th Street. lIn the background is visible a portion of the Sixth Ave. Elevated Line running at this point east and west on West 53rd Street.
October 8, 1900.
Board of Transportation Photograph.
William B. Parsons Collection.

713347f-b.text:
(1)
227-245West 48th Street, north side, between Broadway and Eighth Avenue. In the centre is the Union Church (Methodist Episcopal).
April 6, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same view, four years later. A new building stands at No. 239,
and Nos. 241-243 have been demolished.
March 21, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

717539f-a.text:
Broadway, north from and including 48th Street.
October 1, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

713341f-b.text:
West 48th Street, south side, west from (No. 212-216) a point slightly west of Broadway and showing prominently the Longacre Theatre occupying a building site numbered 220-228. The Hotel President is slightly west of same. This set of two, consists of a negative and a positive.
September 1935.
W.P.A. Photo.

713341f-a.text:
West 48th Street, south side, west from (No. 212-216) a point slightly west of Broadway and showing prominently the Longacre Theatre occupying a building site numbered 220-228. The Hotel President is slightly west of same. This set of two, consists of a negative and a positive.
September 1935.
W.P.A. Photo.

713342f-b.text:
West 48th Street, north side, west from (No. 213) a point slightly west of Broadway and showing the Ritzz Theatre at No. 225 and the Union Methodist Episcopal Church at No. 227-233. The structure on the extreme right and only partially shown is the Eldorado Building, No. 209-213.
This set consists of a negative and a positive view.
1936.
W.P.A. Photo.

713342f-a.text:

This set consists of a negative and a positive view.

1509109-a.title: Broadway - 48th Street, northeast corner
1509109-a.folder: Broadway - 48th Street, northeast corner, Manhattan, NY

717543f-a.text:
Broadway, east side, from 49th to 48th Streets, seen across the clearing left by the demolition of a two-story building on the
N.W. corner of 49th Street.
May 3, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
